data.enText: to put your arms around sb and hold them tightly, especially to show that you like or love them

data.chText: 他们伸出双臂彼此拥抱。
data.enText: They put their arms around each other and hugged.
to put your arms around sth and hold it close to your body

data.chText: 她双臂抱膝坐在椅子上。
data.enText: She sat in the chair, hugging her knees.

data.chText: 他把热水袋紧捂在胸口。
data.enText: He hugged the hot-water bottle to his chest.

data.chText: 有一段距离地挨着（某物）
data.enText: to keep close to sth for a distance

data.chText: 那条小径有一英里紧靠海岸。
data.enText: The track hugs the coast for a mile.

data.chText: 缠紧，缚紧（某物，尤指人体）
data.enText: to fit tightly around sth, especially a person's body
an act of putting your arms around sb and holding them tightly, especially to show that you like or love them

data.chText: 她热烈地拥抱了她的母亲。
data.enText: She gave her mother a big hug.

data.chText: 他停下来接受追随者的拥抱亲吻。
data.enText: He stopped to receive hugs and kisses from the fans.

means: 有一段距离地挨着(某物)

ex.chText: 这两个人见面后拥抱在一起。
ex.enText: The two men met and embraced.

ex.chText: 那个女人把孩子紧紧搂在怀里。
ex.enText: The woman clasped the baby to her bosom.

ex.chText: 他把金子紧紧地攥在手里。
ex.enText: He clasped the gold in his hand.

ex.chText: 他把女友紧紧搂入怀中。
ex.enText: He clasped his girlfriend to him.
She held a baby in her arms.

ex.chText: 这对年轻恋人紧紧相拥。
ex.enText: The young lovers held each other close.

ex.chText: 他们见面后，她抱住了他。
ex.enText: She hugged him when they met.

ex.chText: 她抱着胳膊坐在角落里。
ex.enText: She was sitting in a corner hugging herself.

synonyms.bx: 既可表示拥抱他人，也可表示抱住自己的身体。

example: come here and give me a big hug

tr: squeeze (someone) tightly in your arms, usually with fondness
example: He hugged her close to him

value.def: When you hug someone, you put your arms around them and hold them tightly, for example because you like them or are pleased to see them. You can also say that two people hug each other or that they hug .

example.ex: She had hugged him exuberantly and invited him to dinner the next day...
example.tran: 她兴高采烈地拥抱了他，并邀请他第二天一起吃晚饭。

example.ex: They hugged each other like a couple of lost children...
example.tran: 他们相互紧抱在一起，就像一对迷路的孩子。

example.ex: Syvil leapt out of the back seat, and gave him a hug.
example.tran: 赛维尔从后座跳出来，给了他一个拥抱。

value.def: If you hug something, you hold it close to your body with your arms tightly round it.

example.ex: Shaerl trudged toward them, hugging a large box...
example.tran: 谢尔抱着一个大箱子步履艰难地向他们走去。

example.ex: She hugged her legs tight to her chest...
example.tran: 她将双腿紧紧抱在胸前。

example.ex: She stood hugging her quilted jacket round her.

value.def: Something that hugs the ground or a stretch of land or water stays very close to it.

example.ex: The road hugs the coast for hundreds of miles...
example.tran: 公路沿着海岸延伸数百英里。

example.ex: Our pilot reduced height until we hugged the ground.
example.tran: 飞行员降低了高度，最后我们紧贴着地面飞行。

trans: 拥抱情人节；擁抱情人節；拥抱日
狗熊式拥抱；拥抱大白熊；熊抱；熊的拥抱
乔西·哈格；乔希·哈格；乔什·哈格
